lyrics:
23 contributorstemporary home lyricsverse 1
little boy six years old
a little too used to bein alone
another new mom and dad
another school another house thatll never be home

prechorus 1
when people ask him how he likes this place
he looks up and says with a smile upon his face

chorus
this is my temporary home its not where i belong
windows and rooms that im passin through
this is just a stop on the way to where im goin
im not afraid because i know
this is my temporary home
mmm

verse 2
young mom on her own
she needs a little help got nowhere to go
shes lookin for a job lookin for a way out
cause a halfway house will never be a home

prechorus
at night she whispers to her baby girl
someday well find our place here in this world
see carrie underwood liveget tickets as low as 94you might also likechorus
this is our temporary home its not where we belong
windows and rooms that were passin through
this is just a stop on the way to where were goin
im not afraid because i know
this is our temporary home

bridge
old man hospital bed
the room is filled with people he loves
and he whispers dont cry for me ill see you all someday
he looks up and says i can see gods face

chorus
this is my temporary home its not where i belong
windows and rooms that im passin through
this was just a stop on the way to where im goin
im not afraid because i know
this was my temporary home mmm

outro
this is our temporary home7embed
